bio:treatment.description: Plants perennial, often flowering the first year. Culms to 100 cm, erect or decumbent at the base. Sheaths smooth, glabrous; ligules 4-8 mm, scabridulous, lacerate; blades 10-30 cm long, 4-15 mm wide. Panicles 10-30 cm, erect or nodding, interrupted, dense; pedicels not developed; stipes 1.5-2.5 mm. Glumes 3-5 mm, hispidulous, tapering from about midlength to the acute apices, apices unlobed, awned, awns 1-3 mm; lemmas about 1.5 mm, awned, awns 1-2 mm, arising from above midlength; paleas 1/2 - 2/3 as long as the lemmas; anthers 0.5-0.7 mm. 2n = 28, 56.
bio:treatment.discussion: Polypogon elongatus is native from Mexico to Argentina. It now grows at scattered locations in the Flora region, primarily in California.
